intro: Spitzelia getula, commonly known as the blue flag iris, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to eastern North America. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds, preferring moist to wet soil conditions. Its sword-like leaves are narrow and grass-like, often reaching lengths of up to 30 inches. Spitzelia getula plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and nectar for various pollinators.
